text: Robert L. "Bob" Cardenas (March 10, 1920 - March 10, 2022) was a Mexican- American brigadier general of the United States Air Force. He was born in Mérida, Yucatán, Mexico, but raised in San Diego, California. He served in World War II and the Vietnam War. In 1983, President Ronald Reagan appointed him California coordinator for Southwest Border Economic Action Group. In 1985, he was appointed to Chairman of the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Advisory Group by California Governor George Deukmejian. In 2015, he was added into the National Aviation Hall of Fame.
